rule: The output must classify a given input text into one and only one of the following specific categories: World, Sports, Business, or Sci/Tech.
input: CapitalOne announces a 20% increase in quarterly earnings
validityText:
The input "CapitalOne announces a 20% increase in quarterly earnings" is a string that describes a news event. It specifically discusses an increase in quarterly earnings by a corporation, CapitalOne, which falls under the Business category of news. According to the input specification, the text must represent a news article or headline that falls into one of the specified categories: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech. The given text categorizes as Business news due to its focus on earnings and financial performance. Therefore, this input complies with the input specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output is "Business", which corresponds to one of the categories listed in the description ("World", "Sports", "Business", "Sci/Tech"). The description mandates that the output should classify a news article into one of these categories, and "Business" is indeed one of them. Therefore, the output complies with the description. No assumptions about the input are required to evaluate this compliance.

No violation.
OK
